result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathan Rivera Roman

records.addlTxt: Justice Point Pretrial Services Status Report, filed.

Defendant Jonathan Rivera Roman not in court, in custody.  Attorney Ruby De Leon in court for Jonathan Rivera Roman.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a bail/bond hearing. Defendant's appearance is waived. Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Defense requests a status date to determine case posture. Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Status conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jonathan Rivera Roman not in court, in custody.  Attorney Ruby De Leon in court for Jonathan Rivera Roman.  Attorney Samuel Tabin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney De Leon is new counsel on the case and has not had an opportunity to meet with the defendant.  Bail bond hearing is adjourned for Reserve Branch 13.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Terrance M.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jonathan Rivera Roman appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent appeared by video for Jonathan Rivera Roman. Attorney Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 13.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Branch 13.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
